column2: HAWAII PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Hawaii
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You must signal your intention to turn at least ___ before turning.
column4: 100 feet
column6: 250 feet
column8: 50 feet

column2: 2. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to brake suddenly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column10: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: Reversible lane ahead.
column8: The divided highway ends ahead.

column2: 4. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column6: always drive at the highest speed allowed.
column8: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.

column2: 5. ______________ is an unsafe distraction when driving.
column4: Leaving early to drive to an appointment.
column6: Controlling an emotion before putting the vehicle in gear.
column8: Texting a message on your cell phone.
column10: Asking a passenger to enter your mapping request into your GPS.

column2: 6. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates road user services.
column6: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column8: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 7. Bicyclists:
column4: have the same rights and responsibilities as drivers.
column6: must ride facing traffic.
column8: may ride side by side on roadways.

column2: 8. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: turning right on red is forbidden.
column8: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 9. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column8: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: Shopping centre ahead.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 11. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 12. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: broken white
column6: double solid yellow
column8: solid yellow

column2: 13. When turning left at an intersection or into any driveway you:
column4: must yield to vehicles approaching closely from the opposite direction.
column6: must not block vehicles approaching from the rear.
column8: must not cross any solid yellow line.
column10: should leave room on the right for other vehicles to pass.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: No Bicycle zone
column6: Bicycle repair shop ahead
column8: Bicycles have the right-of-way

column2: 15. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 16. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the crosswalk.
column6: Before the stop line.
column8: After the crosswalk.

column2: 17. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column10: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 18. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: come to a complete stop.
column8: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 19. Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
column4: excessive rain.
column6: excessive stops.
column8: excessive speed.

column2: 20. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 21. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column6: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column8: passing is not allowed.
column10: passing is allowed for both drivers.

column2: 22. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 23. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: stop if necessary.
column8: go to work.

column2: 24. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
column6: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.
column8: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.

column2: 25. A copy of the vehicle inspection certificate:
column4: should be kept at home.
column6: must be filed with your State income tax return.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: should be kept in your vehicle.

column2: 26. When driving on a four-lane divided highway, drivers should know that:
column4: white lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the opposite direction.
column6: yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: None of the above.
column10: white lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: No turn on red

column2: 28. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Honk your horn.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Sharp turn ahead.
column10: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 30. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column6: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column8: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
